climbs.name: Sex and Chocolate with a Cherry on Top (aka S&C Direct)

content.description: Climb Sex and Chocolate, traverse right at break and head straight up the head-wall using the arete and face holds.
content.location: The direct finish to Sex and Chocolate.

content.description:
Start right hand on a the crimp on the face, left hand on the good hold on the arete.  Move onto the arete and make a long move to the slopey jug.  Exit left or right from here, or continue to the top for the direct finish if you're into that sort of thing.  This is the style of problem where there is a fine line between it feeling impossible and impossibly easy... 

  With the completion of the direct finish, this is listed as a separate problem more for historical purposes than anything else...
content.location: If you are facing the Venus rising boulder, continue on hiking trail for 50 feet and go right towards the lake past easy problems on the right. Angle around the backside of these boulders you pass and go down the hill hugging the cliff line on your right. Sex & Chocolate should be on your right.

content.description: Starts on flake pinched between rocks. Get high foot. Work your way into crack and pop your head over the top. Right side of crack is OFF
Short little boulder with a very smooth face, have a seat and give it a hug. Proceed to heel hook your way up to the slopers on top. Fun, strong climbing. Crux is probably the topout.
content.protection: Two pads are nice, but one would suffice.
content.location: It is down hill from Sex and Chocolate 15 or so feet. Short boulder, pretty obvious.   Get down by hopping.

content.description: A right variation to perfect medium where you stay true to the arete.  Pretty powerful and some good moves.  If confused check out the video below.
content.protection: A few pads or more and a spotter.  The landing is not so good, and it's a bit weird near the end since the feet suck and the hands are slopey.

content.description:
Start using arete on right and small crimps on left.  Make your way to the obvious horizontal break at half-height using razor crimp, sloper, and abysmal feet.   

  Continue from the break up easier moves to the top of the boulder if you are feeling brave or just traverse off left or right to ledges. 

  Large foot hold at bottom might be considered "off" by some...just have fun
content.protection: Landing is very flat although boulders off to the side come in to play on topout
content.location: If you are facing the Venus rising boulder, continue on hiking trail for 50 feet and go right towards the lake past easy problems on the right.  Angle around the backside of these boulders you pass and go down the hill hugging the cliff line on your right.  You will pass Sex & Chocolate which is a blank arete/face climb/dyno.  Perfect Medium is just past this on your right, around a corner.

content.description: Start in the dual cracks and make your way up the vertical face.  Some have called the large right hand crack off but really, do whatever is fun.
content.location: Looking at Perfect Medium turn 90 degrees to your left and you'll be looking at Manhattan.

content.description: 7 Feet. Butt start on double crimps to a left hand pinch and right hand on the arete. Proceed to move left on the problem to a pretty straight forward top out.
content.protection: A few pads. There is a large rock in the middle of the landing area... make sure this is well covered and that doesn't end up in the seam of your pads.
content.location: Hike the east bluff trail beginning on the north shore. hike about 3/4 of the way to the monolith area and look for a great lookout on the right. This boulder is off the trail between the main monolith area and the out look point of the lake. When facing the lake it is to the right of the trail.

content.description: From a stand climb the right side of the arête encountering an airy crux.  The top does ease off.
content.location: Just before monolith area at a saddle, 30 feet off the trail and facing the lake. Most walk right past this if heading to the Mean Gurlz Boulder.

content.description: Climb up the left arete of the tall pillar.  There is a committing move that leads to an airy topout above a less than perfect landing.
content.protection: A good number of Pads.  We had 4 and some more would have been nice.
content.location: At the south end of Monolith Ridge - West.  Just Right of "Sex And Chocolate" 10 to 15 feet on the tall, detached pillar.

content.description:
This problem adds a high quality sit start and a bit of difficulty to already the classic "Sex and Chocolate with a Cherry On Top." Start seated with hands on two underclings and then move up and left through thin crimps to join the stand start. Keep it together for the heady top out.

 Some would say that this is the full line on the boulder.

 For the faint of heart, this problem has also been done with a drop from the break (like "Sex and Chocolate").
Climb up the very tall face just left of Sex and Chocolate.  Don't use Detached boulders or the ledge out left.  A fall from high up could be bad.  Good climbing.
content.protection: Lots of pads, I toproped rehearsed it first.
content.location: Just left of Sex and Chocolate

content.description: Start on the big, obvious ledge and go directly up the face on great edges.
content.location: About 20 feet left of Sex And Chocolate.

content.description: The Monolith area is a great place to boulder.
